description: The Energy Department is seeking to bring back nuclear energy specialists after abruptly telling hundreds of workers that their jobs were eliminated, according to two people familiar with the matter.
title: Dismissed Nuclear Bomb Specialists Recalled by Energy Department

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz slammed US Vice President JD Vance’s combative comments on European policy, adding to escalating friction between Europe’s largest economy and one of its most important allies.
title: Germany’s Scholz Slams Vance on Democracy in Escalating Dispute

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Pursues Peace Talks in Ukraine, Trade War Everywhere Else

description: The White House extended its restriction of access by the Associated Press to Air Force One and reiterated that the news organization is barred from Oval Office events because of how it uses President Donald Trump’s new “Gulf of America” label.
title: White House Rift With AP Deepens Over ‘Gulf of America’ Dispute

description: Approval for President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva hit an all-time low as his administration became embroiled in crises and Brazilians grew frustrated with high food prices.
title: Lula’s Popularity Drops to All-Time Low, DataFolha Poll Shows

description: Brookfield Asset Management Ltd.’s decision to shift its head office to New York from Toronto is featured in a new attack ad against Mark Carney, who’s running to become Canadian prime minister.
title: Brookfield’s NYC Move Becomes Political Attack Line on Carney

description: President Donald Trump vowed to complete the long-stalled Constitution Pipeline that would transport natural gas to New York, saying it could slash energy prices in northeastern US states by as much as 70%.
title: Trump Vows Completion of Constitution Pipeline For New Yorkers

description: US Agriculture Secretary Brooke Rollins said farmer payments impacted by Donald Trump’s spending freeze will be honored.
title: Agriculture Secretary Says Pending Farmer Payments Will Be Met

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth plans to seek reductions to forecasted military spending over the next five years and shift those dollars toward still-undefined Pentagon priorities favored by the Trump administration, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Hegseth Set to Seek 8% Spending Shift at Pentagon

description: US President Donald Trump’s comments last week that Nippon Steel Corp. would invest in United States Steel Corp. instead of pursuing a takeover surprised shareholders. It turns out that his words blindsided both companies as well.
title: US Steel, Nippon Steel Were Blindsided by Trump Investment Talk

description: President Donald Trump called for easing water efficiency standards for household appliances and fixtures like dishwashers and sinks, targeting environmental rules embraced by his predecessor Joe Biden.
title: Trump to Roll Back Water Standards for Dishwashers, Sinks

description: Polish authorities arrested a Russian suspected of coordinating acts of sabotage against Poland, the US and other allies by sending parcels containing camouflaged explosives and setting buildings ablaze.
title: Poland Arrests Russian Citizen on Sabotage Network Charges

description: President Donald Trump said he would unveil new tariffs on automobiles, adding to his wave of sweeping import levies as he seeks to remake US trade relationships.
title: Trump Says He Will Introduce New Tariffs on Autos Around April 2

description: The move is expected to keep children who cross the US border alone in government custody for longer.
title: Trump Child Refugee Agency Shares Data With Immigration Enforcers

description: The former chief technologist of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau alleged in a legal filing that the Trump administration is on the verge of deleting a database with sensitive financial information, as concerns mount over billionaire Elon Musk’s efforts to dismantle federal agencies.
title: Sensitive Bank Data Set for Deletion in CFPB Purge, Ex-Aide Says

description: In this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss how the Republican’s about-face on US commitments is sending shockwaves through Europe—but not surprise.
title: Trump Hands Europe the Bill for Ukraine

description: Togo will elect its first set of lawmakers to fill a newly created upper chamber on Saturday.
title: Togo to Elect Lawmakers for Newly Created Upper Chamber

description: A gauge of the dollar fell to a fresh year low, as weak January retail sales data and uncertainty over US tariff policy widened cracks in the consensus for further strength in the currency.
title: Dollar Drops to 2025 Low as Data, Tariffs Undercut Bullish View

description: China’s top diplomat said the country will respond to any further unilateral US sanctions, calling such moves a form of “bullying” in his first major public remarks since US President Donald Trump launched a new trade conflict.
title: China Will Have to Hit Back at US ‘Bullying,’ Top Diplomat Says

description: The Trump administration is laying off 1,300 employees at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, shrinking the public health agency as part of an effort to cut costs across the federal government.
title: Trump Administration Lays Off About 1,300 Employees at the CDC

description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he doesn’t want to be remembered as the president who handed Ukrainian land to Russia.
title: Zelenskiy Says He Doesn’t Want to Be the Leader Who Handed Land to Putin

description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said cannabis needs to be closely studied in order to shape public health policies.
title: Health Secretary RFK Jr. Calls for Thorough Studies of Marijuana

description: Justin Fulcher, co-founder of telemedicine startup RingMD, is leading Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency effort at the US Department of Veterans Affairs, according to two people familiar with the matter.
title: Musk’s Top DOGE Staffer at VA Worked Quietly Before Its Layoffs

description: Switzerland may join other countries in legalizing cannabis after a key legislative body voted in favor of the measure.
title: Swiss Lawmakers Move to Legalize Cannabis

description: Enbridge Inc. Chief Executive Officer Greg Ebel said it would be difficult to revive the scrapped Northern Gateway oil pipeline proposal without major legislative changes that would help such projects move forward in Canada.
title: Enbridge CEO Says Northern Gateway Pipeline Plan Would Be Difficult to Revive

description: In her Wednesday letter refusing an order to drop a corruption case against New York City Mayor Eric Adams, Manhattan’s chief federal prosecutor’s use of one Latin phrase drew a particularly strong response.
title: Departing US Attorney Raises DOJ-Adams ‘Quid Pro Quo’ Concerns

description: Donald Trump’s latest plan to slap tariffs on US imports based on sales taxes in their country of origin could shave £16 billion ($20 billion) off UK economic output over the next two years, in what would be a blow to Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s promise to fire up growth.
title: Trump’s Latest Tariff Plan Threatens UK With £16 Billion Hit

description: Sea cual sea el objetivo que el presidente de EE.UU. decida para Ucrania, una cosa está clara: Europa no está preparada para asumir su enorme parte de la carga.
title: Lo que Trump planea para Ucrania es una carga de US$3 billones para los aliados europeos

description: South Africa is preparing to pitch a bilateral trade agreement to the US if President Donald Trump’s administration revokes the nation’s preferential access to the world’s biggest economy as relations between them sour, people with knowledge of the matter said.
title: South Africa Said to Prefer Bilateral US Trade Deal Over AGOA

description: A group of House Democrats questioned Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent about actions they may have taken in response to President Donald Trump’s recent executive order ending diversity programs.
title: Fed, Treasury Questioned by Democrats Over Trump’s DEI Order

description: Elon Musk’s aggressive push to cancel federal leases is pressuring some municipal bonds backed by payments from the US government.
title: DOGE Effect Stings Muni Bonds Backed by Federal Lease Payments

description: Fragmentation of the world economic order poses an increasing threat to growth and financial stability, according to Klaas Knot.
title: ECB’s Knot Warns End of Global Cooperation Will Prove Costly

description: The US has delegated its representation at a Group of 20 foreign ministers meeting in Johannesburg next week to a locally based official after Secretary of State Marco Rubio snubbed the event.
title: US Sends Local Diplomat to South Africa G-20 After Rubio Snub

description: US Vice President JD Vance accused European leaders of undermining democratic values, taking aim at attempts to regulate hate speech and misinformation on social media as he singled out Romania’s decision to annul a presidential election.
title: Vance Says Europe Is Falling Short on Shared Democratic Values

description: Corporate America is trying to influence the new administration — and showcasing public displays of compliance with Trump’s agenda
title: ‘A Lot of Chaos’: Companies Try to Make Sense of Working with Trump

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the US aims to squeeze Iran’s oil exports to less than 10% of current levels as President Donald Trump renews a campaign of “maximum pressure” on Tehran’s nuclear program.
title: US Aims to Cut Iranian Oil Flows by More Than 90%, Bessent Says

description: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels captured a strategic airport in the Democratic Republic of Congo, expanding their stranglehold over the country’s mineral-rich eastern region.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Capture Strategic Airport in Eastern Congo

description: As US President Donald Trump pushes to end the war in Ukraine and upend the order of the Middle East, one fellow world leader is at the heart of both initiatives: Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
title: Saudi Prince Steps In as Power Broker in Trump’s New World Order

description: Nigerian lawmakers approved an additional $200 million in federal spending this year to fund health services impacted by a freeze of US Agency for International Development funding.
title: Nigeria Commits $200 Million to Offset Trump’s Aid Freeze

description: President Donald Trump is embarking on what may be his most disruptive action yet for the global economy by broadening his grievances to how other countries choose to tax and regulate.
title: Trump Widens Trade Fight to Include Global Taxes and Regulation

description: Turkish authorities launched an investigation into Omer Aras, a top banking executive and a chairman of the country’s influential business group TUSIAD, Haberturk news channel reported.
title: Turkey Launches Probe Into Top Businessman and Banker Omer Aras

description: Tesla and SpaceX both relied on their labor while Musk advocated for a border crackdown.
title: The Undocumented Workers Who Helped Build Elon Musk’s Texas Gigafactory

description: Singapore’s defense minister said the US under the Trump administration has become unpredictable on issues such as trade but added that the city-state should fare well given its strong security ties and positive trade balance with the world’s biggest economy.
title: Singapore Defense Chief Says US Seen as Disruptive But Ties Firm

description: European Union lawmakers called for a halt to financial assistance for Rwanda because of its support for the M23 rebel insurgency in neighboring Democratic Republic of Congo.
title: European Lawmakers Urge Freeze on Aid to Rwanda Over Congo War

description: Vladimir Putin is assembling a heavyweight team with decades of experience in high-stakes negotiations to face off against US President Donald Trump’s representatives for a deal to end Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: Putin Assembles Team of Heavyweights to Negotiate Ukraine Deal

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi was counting on a series of concessions ahead of his meeting with US President Donald Trump to keep his country in the US’s good graces after weeks of tariff threats.
title: Modi Leaves Trump Summit With a To-Do List Despite Concessions

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Tramples Over Ideological Soulmate Milei

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he’s prepared to engage with Donald Trump’s peace initiative and signaled willingness for direct talks with Russia.
title: Zelenskiy Prepared to Discuss Plan With US, Allies, Then Russia

description: World leaders are gathered at the Munich Security Conference, which this year marks a key milestone on the path toward a peace deal for Ukraine.
title: Zelenskiy Opens up for Potential Talks With Russia

description: Argentina’s Javier Milei has spent his presidency cozying up to Donald Trump. So far, it hasn’t kept his nation off the front lines of the US leader’s global trade war.
title: Trade War Puts Milei’s Trump-First Foreign Policy to the Test

description: Two British citizens have been arrested by authorities in Iran, the UK’s Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office said in an emailed statement on Friday.
title: Iran Has Detained Two British Nationals, UK Foreign Office Says

description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the bloc will respond if Donald Trump follows through on his threat to impose global reciprocal tariffs, calling them a “step in the wrong direction.”
title: EU Calls Trump’s Reciprocal Tariffs Plan Step in Wrong Direction

description: Germany’s Left party is looking increasingly likely to retain seats in parliament after next week’s election, while the Free Democrats and the BSW, a new far-left splinter group, remain in danger of crashing out, according to a new opinion poll.
title: German Far-Left Party Enjoys ‘Renaissance’ Ahead of Election

description: Thailand’s pursuit of an expansionary fiscal policy strategy to propel growth faces the risk of rising costs for elderly care, investment and the need to keep public debt level to sustainable levels, according to the World Bank.
title: World Bank Sees Thai Fiscal Risks Mounting Due to Spending Surge

description: Indian buyers of chickpeas from top exporter Australia are defaulting on cargoes or trying to renegotiate prices after an influx of supply.
title: Cheap Chickpeas Spur Indian Buyers to Default on Cargoes

description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te pledged to boost military spending, a move aimed at showing President Donald Trump the democracy is committed to defending itself from China.
title: Taiwan’s Lai Vows to Lift Military Funding After Trump Complaint

description: Creating a defense sector that can deter Russian aggression means overcoming fragmentation, supply-chain bottlenecks and an innovation gap.
title: Europe’s Ailing Defense Industry Faces a Reckoning as Russia Threat Looms

description: If UniCredit SpA Chief Executive Officer Andrea Orcel thought victory for the business-friendly conservatives in next week’s German election might smooth his path to taking control of Commerzbank AG, he seems to have been mistaken.
title: Orcel Faces Fresh Opposition From Merz in Chase for Commerzbank

description: A federal judge temporarily blocked President Donald Trump’s executive order cutting financing for foreign assistance programs administered by the US Agency for International Development.
title: Trump Officials Ordered by Judge to Lift Freeze on USAID Funding

description: China said it welcomed direct communications between US President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, as Beijing supports efforts to find a political settlement to the war in Ukraine.
title: China ‘Glad’ Trump, Putin Are Talking on Ending War in Ukraine

description: South Korea’s Acting President Choi Sang-mok called for raising vigilance and remaining ready to act in response to Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs and other global issues that threaten to compound challenges facing his trade-reliant country.
title: South Korea Beefs Up Readiness Over Trump’s Reciprocal Tariffs

description: China, Russia and North Korea have formed a “triangle of troublemakers” that threatens to transform the Pacific region, a senior US commander has warned, even as President Donald Trump seeks warmer ties with two of those adversaries.
title: US Commander Warns of China, Russia, North Korea ‘Troublemakers’

description: The White House barred an Associated Press reporter from covering an open press conference with President Donald Trump and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the third day its reporters have been blocked from covering the president.
title: White House Bars AP Reporter for Third Day In ‘Gulf of America’ Flap

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi declined to say if he discussed billionaire Gautam Adani’s legal challenges in the US during his meeting with President Donald Trump at the White House.
title: Modi Says ‘Personal Matters’ Like Adani Not Discussed With Trump

description: President Donald Trump’s threat to slap tariffs on imported vehicles puts a $240 billion trade route in the crosshairs, with some of the biggest brands in Germany and South Korea among the most exposed.
title: Trump Floats Auto Tariffs Targeting $240 Billion Trade Spigot
